thread.title: Paul Shaffer makes quick exit after giving Darlene Love award | Page Six
thread.title_full: Paul Shaffer makes quick exit after giving Darlene Love award | Page Six

author: Mara Siegler
title: Paul Shaffer makes quick exit after giving Darlene Love award | Page Six
text:
Paul Shaffer still gets special treatment, even though he’s no longer David Letterman ’s bandleader.
The musician presented singer Darlene Love — who performed on Letterman’s “Late Show” every Christmas — with an award at the Bistro Awards at Gotham Comedy Club on Monday, but needed organizers to change up the order of the show so that he could stick with his schedule.
“Paul was introducing Darlene for the lifetime achievement award, which was supposed to happen at 9:30 p.m.,” says the insider. “But Paul had a flight to catch to LA at 10 p.m. so he opened the show by honoring Darlene and dashed right out. He said he’s heading out to LA to release a new album.”
